author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Medieval Tower Collapse, Shein Protest, and Earthquake in Afghanistan

author: Roslyn Kunin
description: The future belongs to trades and hands-on skills.
title: Want a Job? Ditch the Degree and Pick up a Trade

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Industry Minister Mélanie Joly says Canada is launching dispute settlement proceedings against Stellantis due to the automobile manufacturer’s decision to transfer production from an Ontario plant to a facility in the United States. “These actions are not symbolic,” Joly told the industry and technology committee on Nov. 3. “They’re the direct consequence of the violation […]
title: Ottawa Begins Dispute Settlement Proceedings Against Stellantis for Moving Production to US

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of the Bank of Canada says he thinks interest rates are at the lower end of where they can go as he tries to balance boosting the tariff-hit economy and keeping inflation in check. Speaking at a conference in Toronto, Governor Tiff Macklem says tariffs are a slower-moving pressure than some crises, but […]
title: Interest Rates at Low End of Ideal Balance Between Growth and Inflation: Macklem

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ottawa has rejected a recommendation by an independent commission to boost judges’ salaries by at least $28,000, saying it can’t justify the increase in the current economic climate. The federal government said it “respectfully disagrees” with all of the one-time salary increases the Judicial Compensation and Benefits Commission suggested in its report to the minister […]
title: Federal Government Rejects $28K-$36K Pay Raise for Judiciary

author: Reuters
description: LONDON—Glencore is planning to close its Horne smelter, Canada’s largest copper metal-producing operation, due to environmental issues and the millions of dollars needed to upgrade the facility, two sources with knowledge of the matter said. The London-listed miner does not disclose copper metal production figures for its Canadian operation, but industry sources estimate annual output […]
title: Glencore Plans to Shut Canada’s Largest Copper Metal Operation Over Costs

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new government white paper on digital sovereignty says Ottawa can’t maintain full control over its data if its data storage supplier is subject to the laws of another country. It warns the federal government can only maintain full legal control if it delivers the service itself, or uses service providers that operate completely under […]
title: Data Stored in Canada Can Be Subject to Foreign Courts, Government Paper Warns

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Authorities say the suspects they have in custody over the crown jewel theft do not appear to be part of a network of organized professional crime.
title: Louvre Heist Gang Were Petty Criminals, Paris Prosecutor Says

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canadians should soon have a new banking option as Questrade Financial Group says it has secured regulatory approval to launch Questbank. The company, known for its online trading platform, said Monday it received the final go-ahead from the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions. “We’re Canada’s newest bank today,” Questrade chief executive Edward Kholodenko […]
title: Questrade Secures Approval to Launch Canada’s Newest Bank

author: Epoch Video
description: Members of emergency services work at the scene to rescue a worker after part of the Torre dei Conti tower collapsed near Via dei Fori Imperiali, near the Colosseum in Rome, Italy, on Nov. 3.
title: Torre Dei Conti Tower Collapses in Rome

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government will unveil proposed changes to its electric vehicles sales mandate this winter, federal officials say. Mark Cauchi, director general of energy and transportation at Environment and Climate Change Canada, told MPs on the House of Commons environment committee today his department is looking to share the results of its highly-anticipated review of […]
title: Feds Will Unveil Proposed Changes to EV Sales Mandate This Winter, Officials Say

author: PA Media
description: No migrants have been recorded crossing the English Channel for 11 days, the longest gap so far this year. The most recent date on which people arrived in the UK after making the journey by boat was October 22, according to the latest Home Office data. Bad weather is likely to have played a role […]
title: Longest Gap in Channel Crossings by Migrants so Far This Year

author: PA Media
description: A head teachers’ union has lost a bid to bring a High Court legal challenge against Ofsted over the watchdog’s plan to grade schools through report cards. The National Association of Head Teachers (NAHT), along with head teacher Barbara Middleton, began legal action against Ofsted in May this year, claiming that the body failed to […]
title: Head Teachers’ Union’s Legal Action Over Ofsted Report Card Plans Thrown Out

author: PA Media
description: Counter-terrorism officials could see a record number of referrals under the government anti-extremism scheme Prevent in the wake of the Southport attack. Head of Counter Terrorism Policing Laurence Taylor said a significant increase had been seen since the harrowing murders at a children’s dance class in July 2024. Last week he told MPs there could […]
title: Officials Bracing for Record Number of Referrals to Anti-Extremism Scheme

author: PA Media
description: Four people have suffered minor injuries after a train derailed when it struck a landslide at 80mph. Eighty-seven people, including 10 members of staff, were on board the 4.28am Avanti West Coast service from Glasgow to Euston when it came off the tracks near the village of Shap, in Cumbria, on Monday morning. Network Rail […]
title: Four People Hurt as Train Derails After Hitting Landslide at 80Mph

author: PA Media
description: The stabbing of a 14-year-old boy and two reports of a knifeman seen at a barbers in Peterborough are being investigated as part of the police probe into a mass stabbing on a high speed train. Cambridgeshire police said that the teenager was non-fatally injured at 7.10pm on Friday, before a man with a knife […]
title: Boy Stabbed and ‘Knifeman’ Seen Twice at Barbers in 24 Hours Before Train Attack

author: PA Media
description: A university halted an academic’s research into forced labour in China after facing pressure from Chinese authorities, lawyers have claimed. Leigh Day Solicitors said internal documents from Sheffield Hallam University obtained by freedom of information and subject access requests suggest the university had banned Professor Laura Murphy from continuing her research on forced labour. The […]
title: UK University Halted Forced Labour Research After China Pressure, Lawyers Claim

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The tech giant expands AI and cloud infrastructure in Abu Dhabi and Dubai through 2029, deepening U.S.-UAE tech cooperation.
title: Microsoft Increases UAE Investment to $15.2 Billion After US Clears Nvidia Chip Exports

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Police praised the 'heroic' bravery of a worker who was critically injured while saving others. The media identified the train driver as a Gulf War veteran.
title: Man Appears in Court Charged With UK Mass Train Stabbing

author: The Canadian Press
description: The former Bloc MP who lost her Quebec riding by a single vote is taking the matter to the Supreme Court of Canada. Nathalie Sinclair-Desgagné says she will appeal a recent Quebec Superior Court decision that rejected her request for a new election in the Montreal-area riding of Terrebonne. She had challenged the result after […]
title: Former Bloc MP Who Lost by Single Vote Says She Will Appeal to Supreme Court

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Global Affairs Canada briefing note suggests the department expects fewer questions going forward in the House of Commons about possible cuts to foreign aid from the much-reduced NDP caucus. A June briefing note released under access-to-information law shows the department sought to stop accepting applications for foreign aid programs prioritized by the Trudeau government, […]
title: Government Expects Fewer Questions on Foreign Aid From Weakened NDP: Briefing Note

author: The Associated Press
description: KABUL, Afghanistan—A powerful 6.3 magnitude earthquake shook northern Afghanistan before dawn Monday, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 640 others, as well as damaging the historic Blue Mosque, officials said. The numbers of people killed or injured could rise, officials said. In the town of Khulm, near the epicenter, people dug through […]
title: Powerful 6.3 Earthquake Hits Northern Afghanistan, Killing 20 and Damaging Historic Blue Mosque

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada’s food safety regulator is launching a large-scale inspection initiative of more than 2,400 licensed food production facilities that have yet to be inspected in response to a government review prompted by last year’s deadly listeria outbreak in plant-based milk. The inspection campaign is to be completed by the fall of 2026 and the results […]
title: CFIA Ramps Up Inspections to Prevent Repeat of 2024 Listeria Deaths

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said days before the release of the federal budget that he’s willing to work with the Liberals to draft an “affordable” budget that his party could support. “I’m willing to work all through the night—tonight and tomorrow—to come up with an affordable budget that will make an affordable life for Canadians. […]
title: Poilievre Says Tories Willing to Work With Liberals on ‘Affordable’ Budget as Deadline Nears

author: Tom Ozimek
description: An OECD report said the United States accounted for more than half of all asylum applications in advanced economies in 2024.
title: Asylum Applications Hit Record High in Final Year of Biden Administration: OECD

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The minister ruled out the possibility the incident could have been the work of amateurs, revealing that there was a level of sophistication to the operation.
title: Drones Sighted Near Air Base Could Be Spy Operation, Says Belgian Defense Minister

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The law's framework would require ExxonMobil to apply the same climate mandates to its global operations, not only those within Europe.
title: ExxonMobil CEO Warns EU Sustainability Law Could Force Exit from Europe

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Montrealers have chosen former Liberal Tourism Minister Soraya Martinez Ferrada as their new mayor in a vote that toppled the city’s left-leaning government after eight years in power. Martinez Ferrada, a former Chilean refugee and leader of the centrist party Ensemble Montréal, harnessed the discontent of Montreal residents with the administration of outgoing Mayor Valérie […]
title: Former Liberal Minister Soraya Martinez Ferrada Wins Montreal Mayor’s Seat

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The president said that China's ability to threaten America and its allies by dominating the critical minerals sector will soon fade.
title: US Could End China Dependency on Rare Earths Within 18 Months, Trump Says

author: Guy Birchall
description: The president added that getting the final bodies out of Gaza was 'going to be tough' but that all would eventually be returned.
title: Trump Says Gaza Cease-Fire ‘Very Solid’ as Hamas Returns Bodies of 3 Hostages

author: Victoria Friedman
description: South Korea has committed $150 billion in U.S. shipbuilding investments, with the submarine slated for construction at the Hanwha Philly Shipyard.
title: Pursuit of Nuclear-Powered Submarines Not Intended to Drive Arms Race, Says South Korea

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Japan says at least 17 citizens were abducted by North Korea during the 1970s and 1980s.
title: Japanese Prime Minister Seeks Summit With Kim Jong Un to Resolve Abduction Dispute

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The president’s comments came as U.S. forces increased their operations in the Caribbean region.
title: Trump Says He Doubts US Will Go to War With Venezuela

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: One Nation has seen a surge of support at the polls in the months since the May election.
title: One Nation Leader Visits Mar-a-Lago Ahead of CPAC Speech in Florida

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The president said he envisaged various potential actions to tackle what he said were record numbers of Christians being killed.
title: Trump Doesn’t Rule Out Sending US Troops to Nigeria

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Katter's Australian Party says it won't back down on fighting to introduce 'Castle Law' in the state.
title: Queensland’s Largest Petition Does Not Sway Government on Home Defence Laws

author: Alfred Bui
description: 'In some cases, treatments and surgeries have been foisted upon children by ideologically driven clinicians or parents,' said Henderson.
title: Line Between Medical Need and Radical Ideology: Senator Says Time to Confront Transgender Movement

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Under current laws, voters can receive unsolicited postal vote applications from political parties containing reply-paid envelopes.
title: Teal MP Tries to Ban Political Parties From Handling Postal Vote Applications Amid Privacy Concerns

author: Reuters
description: KYIV—Russian air attacks on Ukraine killed two people overnight and left tens of thousands more – and the entire eastern Donetsk region – without power, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday. Moscow has stepped up missile and drone strikes on Ukraine as winter approaches, triggering outages and forcing emergency crews to quickly repair damage and manage […]
title: Russian Attacks on Ukraine Kill Two, Leave Donetsk Region Without Power

author: The Associated Press
description: MEXICO CITY—A fire and explosion at a convenience store in northwestern Mexico killed at least 23 people, including children, and injured 12 others, state authorities said. The fire occurred Saturday in downtown Hermosillo, the capital of Sonora state, Sonora Gov. Alfonso Durazo said in a video posted on social media. Six people remained hospitalized on […]
title: Fire and Explosion at Store in Northwestern Mexico Leave at Least 23 Dead and a Dozen Injured

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: A new multilateral group, called Nordic 5-New Zealand, recognises the interconnected nature of the countries' strategic environments.
title: New Zealand Forges New Alliance With Nordic Countries, Imposes More Sanctions on Russia

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: President Donald Trump said on Oct. 29 that he had instructed the Department of War to start testing nuclear weapons ‘on an equal basis’ with adversaries.
title: US Nuclear Weapon Testing Won’t Involve Any Explosions, Energy Secretary Says

author: Emel Akan
description: The United States is currently winning the AI race, Trump said, but giving China advanced chips will provide it with 'an equal advantage' in the competition.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Let Nvidia Sell Advanced Chips to China

author: Joseph Lord
description: President Donald Trump has been ambivalent on sending long-range Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine, hoping to achieve peace without such an escalation.
title: Trump Say US Won’t Sell Tomahawk Missiles to Ukraine, for Now

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: A decentralised online crime network which forces young Australians to self-harm is the target of a new taskforce.
title: Police Target ‘Sadistic’ Network of Exploiting Australian Children, 59 People Identified so Far

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: MP Andrew Gee argued many families chose land near state forests expecting privacy buffers, only to find themselves facing industrial-scale wind proposals.
title: Former Nationals MP Pushes to Ban Wind Farms in State Forests

author: PA Media
description: A “heroic” member of LNER rail staff who tried to stop a train knife attacker and “undoubtedly saved people’s lives” remains in a life-threatening condition, British Transport Police (BTP) said. The staff member, who has not been named, was one of 10 people taken to hospital after the mass stabbing on Saturday’s 6.25pm train service […]
title: ‘Heroic’ Rail Worker ‘Saved People’s Lives’ Trying to Stop Knife Attack

author: PA Media
description: Ministers are set to create a new quango to run military housing after concluding the Ministry of Defence was not up to the job. The new Defence Housing Service, to be announced by Defence Secretary John Healey on Monday, will take over management of service accommodation after years of complaints about poor quality homes. It […]
title: New Body to Run Military Housing as MoD Plans Decade-Long Accommodation Overhaul

author: PA Media
description: Leading radiographers have raised serious concerns about “unsafe” high street clinics offering baby scans without a trained specialist after reports of babies being misdiagnosed as having died and medical emergencies being missed. The Society of Radiographers said there has been a proliferation of high street clinics offering pregnancy scans. It said anyone with an ultrasound […]
title: Radiographers Sound Alarm Over High Street Baby Scans

author: PA Media
description: The growing use of AI is putting millions of UK households at growing risk of unvetted rogue traders, the boss of Checkatrade has warned. It came as the platform for tradespeople said it has blocked hundreds of cowboy traders from listing on its platform despite increased scrutiny from the competition watchdog. Jambu Palaniappan, chief executive […]
title: Britons at Growing Risk of Rogue Traders Due to AI, Checkatrade Boss Says

author: PA Media
description: Nigel Farage will pledge to form “the most pro-business” government in British history if Reform UK comes to power as he sets out his economic plans on Monday. The Reform leader is expected to use a speech in London to promise sweeping deregulation, arguing the UK has not made the most of Brexit. According to […]
title: Farage to Row Back From Tax Cuts as He Pledges ‘Most Pro-Business’ Government

author: The Associated Press
description: JERUSALEM—Israel on Sunday announced that the remains of three hostages had been handed over from Gaza and would be examined by forensic experts, as a fragile month-old ceasefire held. A Hamas statement earlier said the remains were found Sunday in a tunnel in southern Gaza. Since the ceasefire took effect on Oct. 10, Palestinian militants […]
title: Israel Says It Received the Remains of 3 Hostages From Gaza

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A Queensland Nationals MP says nearly one in four jobs in his electorate would go if net zero aspirations go ahead. The Nationals have voted against the push.
title: Nationals MP Warns 24 Percent of Local Jobs Could go Under Net Zero
